channel.title: White Lies
channel.description: In 1965, Rev. James Reeb was murdered in Selma, Alabama. Three men were tried and acquitted, but no one was ever held to account. Fifty years later, two journalists from Alabama return to the city where it happened, expose the lies that kept the murder from being solved and uncover a story about guilt and memory that says as much about America today as it does about the past.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
channel.itunes:summary: In 1965, Rev. James Reeb was murdered in Selma, Alabama. Three men were tried and acquitted, but no one was ever held to account. Fifty years later, two journalists from Alabama return to the city where it happened, expose the lies that kept the murder from being solved and uncover a story about guilt and memory that says as much about America today as it does about the past.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Lies, secrecy, and an unsolved murder in Selma, Alabama.
channel.itunes:author: NPR

item.title: A Dangerous Kind Of Self-Delusion
item.description: In our final episode, we examine the legacy of the Rev. James Reeb's death. We speak both to his descendants and to those of one of his attackers, exploring how the trauma and the lies that followed it affected both families.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: A Dangerous Kind Of Self-Delusion
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In our final episode, we examine the legacy of the Rev. James Reeb's death. We speak both to his descendants and to those of one of his attackers, exploring how the trauma and the lies that followed it affected both families.
item.content:encoded: In our final episode, we examine the legacy of the Rev. James Reeb's death. We speak both to his descendants and to those of one of his attackers, exploring how the trauma and the lies that followed it affected both families.

item.title: Learn Not To Hear It
item.description: In Episode 6, we reveal the identity of the fourth man who participated in the attack on the Rev. James Reeb.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: Learn Not To Hear It
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 6, we reveal the identity of the fourth man who participated in the attack on the Rev. James Reeb.
item.content:encoded: In Episode 6, we reveal the identity of the fourth man who participated in the attack on the Rev. James Reeb.

item.title: The X On The Map
item.description: In Episode 5, we search for the fourth attacker while digging into the murder of Jimmie Lee Jackson, a black civil rights activist who was murdered in Alabama just weeks before the Rev. James Reeb. Jackson's killer was brought to justice in 2010. We look at his case for strategies to help solve Reeb's.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: The X On The Map
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 5, we search for the fourth attacker while digging into the murder of Jimmie Lee Jackson, a black civil rights activist who was murdered in Alabama just weeks before the Rev. James Reeb. Jackson's killer was brought to justice in 2010. We look at his case for strategies to help solve Reeb's.
item.content:encoded: In Episode 5, we search for the fourth attacker while digging into the murder of Jimmie Lee Jackson, a black civil rights activist who was murdered in Alabama just weeks before the Rev. James Reeb. Jackson's killer was brought to justice in 2010. We look at his case for strategies to help solve Reeb's.

item.title: The Sphinx Of Washington Street
item.description: In Episode 4, we find a woman who says she knows who killed the Rev. James Reeb, because she was there. She's ready — for the first time in more than 50 years — to tell the truth about what she saw.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: The Sphinx Of Washington Street
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 4, we find a woman who says she knows who killed the Rev. James Reeb, because she was there. She's ready — for the first time in more than 50 years — to tell the truth about what she saw.
item.content:encoded: In Episode 4, we find a woman who says she knows who killed the Rev. James Reeb, because she was there. She's ready — for the first time in more than 50 years — to tell the truth about what she saw.

item.title: The Counternarrative
item.description: In Episode 3, we break down the conspiracy theory that emerged after the Rev. James Reeb's murder: that he was allowed to die or was killed because the civil rights movement needed a white martyr.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: The Counternarrative
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 3, we break down the conspiracy theory that emerged after the Rev. James Reeb's murder: that he was allowed to die or was killed because the civil rights movement needed a white martyr.
item.content:encoded: In Episode 3, we break down the conspiracy theory that emerged after the Rev. James Reeb's murder: that he was allowed to die or was killed because the civil rights movement needed a white martyr.

item.title: The Who And The What
item.description: In Episode 2, we unravel the aftermath of the Rev. James Reeb's murder: the arrest of three men and the defense brought at trial. We also track down the last living jurors.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: The Who And The What
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 2, we unravel the aftermath of the Rev. James Reeb's murder: the arrest of three men and the defense brought at trial. We also track down the last living jurors.
item.content:encoded: In Episode 2, we unravel the aftermath of the Rev. James Reeb's murder: the arrest of three men and the defense brought at trial. We also track down the last living jurors.

item.title: The Murder Of The Rev. James Reeb
item.description: In 1965, the Rev. James Reeb was murdered in Selma, Ala. No one was ever held to account. We return to the town where it happened, searching for new leads in an old story.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
item.itunes:title: The Murder Of The Rev. James Reeb
item.itunes:author: NPR
item.itunes:summary: In 1965, the Rev. James Reeb was murdered in Selma, Ala. No one was ever held to account. We return to the town where it happened, searching for new leads in an old story.

item.title: Introducing White Lies
item.description: A new serialized podcast from NPR investigates a 1965 cold case. New episodes every Tuesday starting May 14.
item.copyright: Copyright 2019 NPR - For Personal Use Only
